title: Additional Measures To Address the Crime Emergency in the District of Columbia
summary: Executive Order 14339, issued on August 25, 2025, outlines additional measures to address the crime emergency in the District of Columbia. Key actions include: (1) Increasing the presence of the United States Park Police to enforce laws and maintain public safety; (2) Hiring additional prosecutors to focus on violent and property crimes; (3) Establishing an online portal for Americans with law enforcement experience to join federal law enforcement entities; (4) Creating a specialized unit within the D.C. National Guard to ensure public safety and order; (5) Ensuring that state National Guard units are trained and available for rapid mobilization to assist in quelling civil disturbances; (6) Investigating non-compliance with crime-prevention requirements by housing authorities and landlords; (7) Conducting additional inspections of federally-funded transit services to ensure safety; (8) Reviewing and updating Metropolitan Police Department General Orders to address the crime emergency. The order emphasizes implementation consistent with applicable law and subject to the availability of appropriations.
